content: front and back panels from the sleeve panels by with rs of your work facing you and the neckline marking them using 4 numbered stitch markers pointing downwards as shown in photo 22 move with rs of the garment facing you counting from marker #4 one st to the right and marker #1 one st right to left and starting with the 1st half_double_crochet made on to the left this brings both markers over to the the last yoke round pm in corner slsts and number sleeve panels on the yoke pm in top of first st of last these markers from 1 to 4 by attaching a small piece short row marker #5 and last st of last short row of paper to them adding numbered beads or marker #6 go to separating for sleeves otherwise color coding them for further reference later on do not remove markers until you get to the sleeves the back panel is delimited by stitch markers #1 and #4 marked stitches included the front panel is delimited by stitch markers #2 and #3 marked stitches included the remaining stitches are for the sleeves after the last yoke round you will end up with 67 73 79 87 93 101 107 113 121 127 sts for each front photo 22 short row completed dewdrop sweater 2024 pattern and design by crochethighway all rights reserved 11 next you ll separate the yoke into body and sleeves creating a chain at the underarm turn your work so that the ws is facing you photo 27 photo 28 setup round ws chain 1 half_double_crochet in first st and pm in this half_double_crochet yellow marker photo 23 slip_stitch in next st half_double_crochet in next st across the short row until you reach marker #5 placing your last half_double_crochet in marked st photo 24 chain 13 15 17 17 19 19 21 23 23 25 for the first underarm photo 25 skip entire sleeve panel and half_double_crochet in slip_stitch marked with marker #3 on the front panel of the yoke photo 26 slip_stitch in next st half_double_crochet in next st across the front panel until you reach marker #2 placing your last half_double_crochet in marked st photo 27 chain 13 15 17 17 19 19 21 23 23 25 for the second underarm photo 28 skip entire sleeve panel and slip_stitch in first half_double_crochet marked with yellow photo 29 marker to join photo 29 turn 160 176 192 208 224 240 256 272 288 304 st with rs of your work facing you and the neckline pointing downwards move marker #2 one st to the right and marker #3 one st to the left this brings both markers over to the sleeve panels on the yoke do not remove markers until you get to the sleeves go to body photo 23 photo 24 round 1 rs chain 1 skip the joining slip_stitch and working in back bumps of chs across the underarm and into the stitches across the front
